input: <web-search mcp-server="ydc-server">Find current information about: document image augmentation OCR text similarity 2024</web-search>

trajectory.content:
I couldn’t access a `ydc-server` MCP web-search resource, so I pulled results directly from the web with `python3` + `urllib`.

**Findings (2024 focus)**  
- Hugging Face blog: “Introducing TextImage Augmentation for Document Images” (2024). Describes a document-image augmentation pipeline that preserves text integrity while applying image transforms; highlights joint text+image augmentation for document VLM fine-tuning. https://huggingface.co/blog/doc_aug_hf_alb  
- arXiv 2408.02253 / ACL Findings 2024: “Advancing Post-OCR Correction: A Comparative Study of Synthetic Data.” Shows synthetic data improves post-OCR correction; introduces glyph-similarity–based synthetic data generation; reduces CER across languages, especially low-resource. https://arxiv.org/abs/2408.02253  
- CVPR 2024: “ODM: A Text-Image Further Alignment Pre-training Approach for Scene Text.” Proposes OCR-Text de-stylization modeling to better align text instances with image regions for OCR tasks; focuses on text-image alignment pre-training. https://openaccess.thecvf.com/content/CVPR2024/html/Duan_ODM_A_Text-Image_Further_Alignment_Pre-training_Approach_for_Scene_Text_CVPR_2024_paper.html  
- arXiv 2412.04137: “Text Change Detection in Multilingual Documents Using Image Comparison.” Uses word-level text-image comparison to detect changes without OCR, improving multilingual document comparison robustness. https://arxiv.org/abs/2412.04137  
- Springer Journal of Big Data 2024: “OCR2SEQ … multi-modal data augmentation.” Describes generative augmentation tailored for sequence-to-sequence OCR, simulating realistic OCR errors to improve training in sparse vocabularies. https://link.springer.com/article/10.1186/s40537-024-00927-4  

If you want, I can dig into any of these papers for specific methods (augmentation types, similarity metrics, datasets) or build a focused bibliography.

input: <web-search mcp-server="ydc-server">Find current information about: CFTC commitments of traders current week report 2025 download txt file</web-search>

trajectory.content:
Here are the official CFTC “current week” COT TXT downloads (comma‑delimited) from the Commitments of Traders page:

- Legacy Futures‑Only: https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/deafut.txt  
- Legacy Futures+Options Combined: https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/deacom.txt  
- Supplemental (CIT): https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/deacit.txt  
- Disaggregated Futures‑Only: https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/f_disagg.txt  
- Disaggregated Futures+Options Combined: https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/c_disagg.txt  
- Traders in Financial Futures Futures‑Only: https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/FinFutWk.txt  
- Traders in Financial Futures Futures+Options Combined: https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/FinComWk.txt  

Source page: https://www.cftc.gov/MarketReports/CommitmentsofTraders/index.htm
